main event: A bright cone-shaped object was observed moving straight and then making sudden 90-degree turns on 31 December 1957.
interesting points: The object had a red square body with a round object below it.,The sighting lasted for about 5-10 minutes.,The object was described as being very bright.,Conclusions drawn suggested it was probably a balloon.,The object appeared to separate into three sections during the sighting.
witness description: Described the object size as about the size of a dime and looked like a new nickel.
